name: Centara Hotel Hat Yai

reviews.text: i've only started to stay here past 2-3 years. the price per night is very very reasonable cos the surrounding hotels are about MYR10-15 cheaper but u get a much better room with centara. the rooms have gotten cleaner and more enjoyable but the food has taken a giant spiral turn to the ground. feels like they'r r cutting corners by the food quantity, quality and the x mas dinner was so so horrid. however, if u r not expecting 4 star when u arrive then u'll be quite happy.

reviews.text: The hotel is probably built and operated by an other chain/brand previous and now taken over by the Accor group. It does not correspond to their Novotel brand level, rather Ibis.
Food quality was poor. We never ate, but the sight of the overcooked buffet was enough. Decoration was cheesy and pretty worn-out. Rooms were filthy.
reviews.title: Right in the spot
Nice and cozy hotel
reviews.text: As we ordered the room (suite to accomodate 2 adults and 2 young teenagers) we had confirmed that it was OK, and breakfast would be complimentary for the children (up to 16 y). At the hotel we had to negotiate for extra beds and spend lenghty arguments to have the previous offered breakfast.

I stayed in this hotel a couple of times before (quite a number of years ago). I was thus, very impressed upon walking into my corner room to see what an improvement the reno had done to the room. Anyway, let's start from the beginning...
reviews.title: Totally Impressed!

reviews.text: We booked through a local Hadyai Travel Agency which had always given us the best rate and this had not increased much since my earlier bookings years ago - which added on to my jubilation at seeing the improved room, as usually after reno the price jumps too! Anyway, at check-in they initially couldn't find our two rooms reservation. It was discovered that they had our reservation as arriving the day earlier. Anyway, no issue since the hotel wasn't full. However, the manager/supervisor said if I wanted the rooms to be next to each other it would have to be 1 twin and 1 king. There is no inter-connecting room at Centara. I mentioned that I'd prefer both rooms to be king bedded but if no choice then no choice since priority was for proximity of both rooms. He surprised me by handing me keys to two king bedded rooms right next to each other after a few minutes! It was a good start already!
reviews.title: Good Room

reviews.text: We were given rooms on the 9th floor. 1 was a corner room and it was definitely nicer and roomier than the next room. It also has a two seater sofa while the non corner room only had an arm chair. I really love the new design and colors of the room. Right from the gorgeous patterned carpet to the coloured feature wall behind the bed to the stark and modern bathroom. I'd prefer a walk-in rain shower rather than a bath tub though...
reviews.title: The best in town. But look at thw competition.
Nothing special but good enough
reviews.text: The bed was huge (actually it was two single beds pushed together). Good TV channel selection. Negative points for the room were these items were not provided : Bathrobes, slippers, tea and coffee making facilities. Interesting... Since when I checked out their official website all rooms were meant to be equipted with these items. Another negative point is the very unusual in-room safety deposit box. Pre-historic even! Guests are required to ask for the key from Front Desk but the key despite being the correct one (can turn in the lock) the safe door couldn't be opened. When I told the Front Desk they offerred their safety deposit box. So obviously, this is a common problem. Another minor negative point was the large sliding windows were locked up and couldn't be opened. However, these were truly minor issue for me.
Otherwise, I love everything else about the room. Aircond worked very well, very quiet. Now the hotel is apparently fully non-smoking. But I did detect a very slight whift of ciggy smell.
reviews.title: so called the better one in Hatyai

description: The hotel with 248 rooms, apartments and freshly renovated suites, situated in the centre of bustling Hat Yai, the commercial and shopping hub of Southern Thailand. An 20-storey building (1st to 5th floors comprise Hat Yai's branch of Central Department Store). Only 20 minutes from the airport and accessible by airplane, bus or train from Bangkok.
